summary: This is a small tip for people who want more FPS, smoother gameplay. Try it!
descriptionHtml:
[center][size=3]First, excuse my English. This is not my native language. 




[/size][font=Georgia][b][size=6][color=#666666]==============[/color][color=#d8d8d8]  [/color][color=#6d9eeb]Introduction [/color][color=#6d9eeb] [/color][color=#666666]==============[/color][/size]
[/b][/font][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=3]
This is a small but effective tweak to include in the Skyrim configuration file.
These lines is apparently already in the file itself, but hidden.

[/size][/font][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=3][color=#ffd966][b]These changes are primarily intended for users who have a low or mid-level computer[/b].
[/color]FPS gain is also much more important in interior locations, especially where there are light sources.
Look at the screenshots for an overall idea.

[color=#ffd966][b]ENB users, try, it seems to be useful. But continue reading, please.[/b][/color]
[/size][/font][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=3]I don't know how much the FPS gain will be[/size][/font] [font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=3]on a powerful computer because I do not have one.[/size][/font][/center][center][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=3]You can see my specs at the bottom of the page. 



[/size][/font][font=Georgia][b][size=6][color=#666666]==========[/color][color=#d8d8d8] [/color][color=#6d9eeb]So what it does, exactly [/color][color=#6d9eeb]? [/color][color=#666666]==========[/color][/size]
[/b][/font][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=3]
In fact, these changes will reduce the distance of the "lod" on the specularity effects of the game,
as the shine and refraction effect on objects. 

[/size][/font][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=3][color=#ffd966][b]Look at the latest screenshots I took. You will clearly see the differences.[/b][/color]
Personally, considering the visual and performance aspect, I like more the ones with the tweak.
Without the tweak, I feel like the objects are wet. It's up to you.

[/size][/font][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=3][color=#ffd966][b]However, it's important that you know that this tweak will not break your game in any ways.[/b]
[/color]If you do not like the result, it's easy to remove the changes, either by removing the added lines or
simply using your previously saved configuration files.[/size][/font]





[font=Georgia][b][size=6][color=#666666]====[/color][color=#d8d8d8]  [/color][color=#6d9eeb]I read the description and I want to try it  [/color][/size][color=#666666][size=6]====[/size][/color]
[size=5] [/size]
[/b][/font][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=3]First of all, make a backup of your current configuration files ([i]Skyrim.ini[/i]  and [i]SkyrimPref.ini [/i])

After you made that, it's simple : Copy the following lines and paste them somewhere into your [i]Skyrim.ini[/i]
usually located here : (C:\Users\''Your name''\Documents\My Games\Skyrim)

[/size][/font][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][color=#93c47d][size=3][LightingShader]
[/size][/color][/font][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][color=#93c47d][size=3]fDecalLODFadeEnd=0.0600
[/size][/color][/font][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][color=#93c47d][size=3]fDecalLODFadeStart=0.0500
[/size][/color][/font][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][color=#93c47d][size=3]fEnvmapLODFadeEnd=0.0
[/size][/color][/font][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][color=#93c47d][size=3]fEnvmapLODFadeStart=0.0
[/size][/color][/font][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][color=#93c47d][size=3]fEyeEnvmapLODEnd=0.0
[/size][/color][/font][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][color=#93c47d][size=3]fRefractionLODFadeEnd=0.0[/size]
[/color][/font][color=#93c47d][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=3]fRefractionLODFadeStart=0.0[/size][/font]
[/color][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][color=#93c47d][size=3]fSpecularLODFadeEnd=0.0
[/size][/color][/font][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][color=#93c47d][size=3]fSpecularLODFadeStart=0.0
[/size][/color][/font][font=Georgia][size=5][b]
Now, be amazed !

[img]http://38.media.tumblr.com/d2d97e94e4b5bd5d9334cf2f85f88ddf/tumblr_n8tqcqPhPB1thowlgo1_250.gif[/img]


[/b][/size][/font][b][font=Georgia][size=5]Thats all folks !  I hope this little tweak will be useful ![/size][/font][/b][font=Georgia][size=5]

[/size][/font][font=Georgia][color=#ffd966][size=5][b]Give me your feedback about the tweak in the posts section

[/b][/size][/color][/font][b][font=Georgia][size=5]Endorse if you like




[/size][/font][/b][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=3][u]Here's my specs[/u][/size][/font] :[/center][center][font=Lucida Sans Unicode][size=3]
Windows 8.1 Professional
Install on SSD
Intel Core i5 450M 2.4 GHz
8 GB System RAM
NVIDIA Geforce GT 330M
1 GB VRAM


[/size][/font]  [/center]
author: JackHerer93
